main event: Three separate UFO sightings reported in 1952 and 1953 in different locations in the United States.
interesting points: One sighting reported five to six green ball-like objects traveling at approximately 2,000 mph at an elevation of around 2,000 feet.
Another sighting described an elongated, dark grey object that moved silently over Lake Elsinore, with the observer unable to estimate its size or distance.

The third sighting involved 11 crew members aboard an aircraft who reported observing four bright, round objects, approximately 30 to 40 feet in diameter, flying at an estimated altitude of 10,000 to 15,000 feet at a speed of approximately 400 to 500 mph, executing quick darting maneuvers.
All sightings mentioned the lack of physical evidence to substantiate the observations.
The declassification process for the reports followed a 12-year interval, as indicated by the document.
sighted object: green ball-like objects, an elongated dark grey object, and bright, round metallic objects
location: various locations in the United States (specifically mentioned: Riverside County, California and Corona, California)
witnesses: Airman, observer over Lake Elsinore, 11 crew members aboard an aircraft
photographs: Part of the report includes a sketch or drawing of a UFO or unidentified aerial object
